About Me

About Me

myself ()

About Me

My name is Natasha Ting. I am a masters student in economics at the University of Alberta. I love economics and entrepreneurship. One day, I will have a business and some impact.

What I do

I like to think that I translate economics learning into somewhat useful action items. Within economics, I particularly enjoy anything macroeconomics, growth theories, anything econometrics, and financial economics.

Outside of economics, I read, write, hike, dance, and play some music. I love jokes and listen to good conversations. For leisure, I debate competitively.

Geography

I grew up in a little town in the West Coast of Malaysia. Outside of the little town, I have lived in Edmonton, Kuala Lumpur, and Auckland. I currently live in Edmonton, the northernmost city in the North America (fun).

About This Blog

I’ve always had a lot to say and there were always avenues. The 11, 15, and 17 years old me will be proud that I’ve always had, and still have, a blog. I started this blog in the summer of 2018, and it will at some point become more academic or professional.


My Work

Here are some of my projects.

Economics

Some Economics


(Feb 2019) Used and analyzed models for price simulation to compute cashflow-at-risk. Models through MATLAB.


(Feb 2019) Tried out business school-style case study at an undergrad conference in school.


(Jan 2019) Created an investment portfolio designer by minimizing risks through n-asset mean-variance analysis. Won a prize in a hackathon.

Not Economics


(Apr 2020) My part of a math modelling paper, focusing on methods to estimate the SIRD as a system.


(Feb 2020) Developed an implementation of the Analytical Hierachical Process and won a prize in a math modelling competition.


(Nov 2018) Simple Android app to foster community safety, written in Java. I worked on the front end for this project. Got an honourable mention in a hackathon.
